result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah O. Breiwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah O. Breiwick

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
Per call received from Kelly Hansen @ DOC probation review hearing has been canceled for 8/25/16 as DE has made his payment in full.
Probation review hearing on August 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State. Defendant, Noah O. Breiwick, appeared with Attorney Jeremy Chavez. Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs including DNA surcharge.  See conditions.  Cash Bond on deposit to be applied and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.
Granting Defendant's Stipulated Motion for Substituted Counsel filed by Atty Chavez
Stipulated Motion for Substitution of Counsel filed by Atty Chavez
Atty Chavez appeared after the hearing stating he has been retained and will be filing a notice of retainer.  Court clerk informed him of the next hearing date.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Angela Komp appeared on behalf of Defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Komp has no explanation for DE's non appearance.  Upon authorization of a warrant court is informed by a female that DE is in custody in the Racine Co Jail.  Cout will not issue warrant and adjourns hearing to 9/24/15 at 8:50 AM.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
